thread.title: Greenlight Buys BNY Mellon, Applied Materials, Sells EMC
thread.title_full: Greenlight Buys BNY Mellon, Applied Materials, Sells EMC - Bloomberg Business

author: Simone Foxman
title: Greenlight Buys BNY Mellon, Applied Materials, Sells EMC
text:
Billionaire David Einhorn’s Greenlight Capital has bought shares in Bank of New York Mellon Corp., anticipating the custody bank will benefit from an increase in interest rates.
The firm will see organic revenue growth after a couple of years of poor performance and cut expenses significantly, Einhorn wrote in a letter to investors on Monday. Greenlight bought its position in BNY Mellon at an average price of $40.61. The shares rose 1.7 percent to $42.40 at 3:22 p.m. in New York.
Einhorn wrote in the letter that it was a challenging quarter to find new long ideas. In addition to BNY Mellon, New York-based Greenlight took a small position in Applied Materials Inc., a semiconductor equipment manufacturer that canceled a merger with Tokyo Electron Ltd. because of anti-trust concerns.
Greenlight exited positions in Altice SA, Conn’s Inc., EMC Corp. and Marvell Technology Group Ltd., according to the letter.
